clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the relief of discomfort associated with acute painful musculoskeletal conditions

contraindications.disease: Oral mouse LD sub 50 sub 440 mg kg Oral rat LD sub 50 sub 763 mg kg Symptoms of overdose include diarrhea dizziness drowsiness headache light headedness nausea and vomiting
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Chlorzoxazone is a centrally acting agent for painful musculoskeletal conditions Data available from animal experiments as well as human study indicate that chlorzoxazone acts primarily at the level of the spinal cord and subcortical areas of the brain where it inhibits multisynaptic reflex a c involved in producing and maintaining skeletal muscle spasm of varied etiology The clinical result is a reduction of the skeletal muscle spasm with relief of pain and increased mobility of the involved muscles
